pageContext.claim: “We, right now, have the cleanest air and the cleanest water, which is what I want. I want absolutely immaculate air and crystal, clean water.”
pageContext.analysis: The United States does not have the world's best air quality, as Trump claimed. According to WHO's database of the annual average concentrations of fine particulate matter in urban areas, Australia, Brunei Darussalam, Canada, Estonia, Finland, Iceland, Sweden and New Zealand each were less polluted than the United States in 2016.
